parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
